sources.title: AaC Open Source Project. – Architecture-as-Code Repository
sources.summary: Open source repository showcasing the Architecture as Code reference implementation and tooling patterns used throughout the manuscript.

sources.title: Architecture Decision Records Community. – ADR Guidelines and Templates
sources.summary: Community-maintained catalogue of ADR practices that underpins the book's discussion on decision records and traceability.

sources.title: Atlassian. – Documentation as Code: Treating Docs as a First-Class Citizen
sources.summary: Explains how treating documentation like source code improves collaboration and auditability, reinforcing foundational Architecture as Code practices.

sources.title: Atlassian. – Git Workflows for Architecture as Code
sources.summary: Outlines collaborative Git workflows that the manuscript recommends for evolving architectural assets safely and transparently.

sources.title: Brown, S. – C4 Model Overview
sources.summary: Introduces the C4 visualisation model that informs the manuscript's approach to automated diagramming and architectural communication.

sources.title: Brown, S. – Documenting Software Architecture with Structurizr
sources.summary: Details practical guidance for documenting architecture with Structurizr, directly informing the book's diagram automation guidance.

sources.title: CNCF. – State of Cloud Native Development 2024
sources.summary: Quantifies cloud-native adoption trends that establish the urgency for Architecture as Code capabilities highlighted in the manuscript.

sources.title: GitLab. – Documentation as Code: Best Practices and Implementation
sources.summary: Captures documentation-as-code techniques the manuscript reuses when establishing architecture repositories and contribution workflows.

sources.title: GitLab. – Building a Single Source of Truth with APIs and CLI
sources.summary: Explains how integrated tooling forms a single source of truth, supporting the governance automation described in the book.

sources.title: GitHub Docs. – About protected branches
sources.summary: Official guidance on branch protection rules referenced when defining governance controls for architecture repositories.

sources.title: HashiCorp. – Policy as Code Overview
sources.summary: Describes Terraform's policy-as-code capabilities that the manuscript uses to demonstrate automated compliance checks.

sources.title: HashiCorp. – Securing Terraform State
sources.summary: Highlights security practices for Terraform state management aligned with the book's Infrastructure as Code security coverage.

sources.title: Martin, R. – Clean Architecture
sources.summary: Foundational text on architectural principles cited when grounding Architecture as Code in established software design practices.

sources.title: Ford, Neal, et al. – Building Evolutionary Architectures
sources.summary: Explores evolutionary architecture techniques that underpin the book's emphasis on continual architectural refinement.

sources.title: Pulumi. – Testing Infrastructure as Code Programs
sources.summary: Demonstrates IaC testing practices the manuscript uses to advocate for inclusive architecture and infrastructure validation.

sources.title: FINOS. – CALM: Common Architecture Language Model
sources.summary: Provides the community-led architecture language model that informs the manuscript's guidance on narrative consistency.
